text: Ants Antson (11 November 1938 - 31 October 2015) was an Estonian speed skater. He competed for the Soviet Union.Ants Antson . sports-reference.com Antson had his best year in 1964, when he became European Allround Champion on the 1500 m at the 1964 Winter Olympics in Innsbruck, and set a new world record on the 3000 m. For his achievements that year, he received the Oscar Mathisen Award. He retired after the 1968 Winter Olympics. ==References== ==Other websites== * Ants Antson at SpeedSkatingStats.com * Personal records from Jakub Majerski's Speedskating Database * Evert Stenlund's Adelskalender pages * Results of Soviet Championships at SpeedSkating.ru * Legends of Soviet Sport (in Russian) Category:1938 births Category:2015 deaths Category:1964 Winter Olympics Category:1968 Winter Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Tallinn Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Speed skaters
title: Ants Antson
